UIAA|Germany: System used by the International Climbing and Mountaineering Federation.
UK Tech: "The British grading system for traditional climbs."
UK ADJ: "The Adjectival English Scale or the overall assessment scale."
FB|French British: "Sport climbing in Britain and Ireland uses the French grading system."
French: "The French numerical system rates a climb according to the overall technical difficulty and strenuousness of the route."
Saxon|Swiss: "The Saxon grading system was developed in the beginning of the 20th century for the formidable Saxon Switzerland climbing region."
YDS|YDS_class: "The Yosemite Decimal System of grading routes of hikes and climbs developed for the Sierra Nevada range."
Mixed: which is the most widely used system in North America."
column12: "Waterfall ice rating system as used in the Canadian Rockies."
column13: "Mixed climbing has its own grading scale that roughly follows the WI rating system."
